revised_title: Oxygen Chemisorption and Defect Formation on Nickel Single-Crystal Surfaces
tldr: The authors studied the chemisorption of oxygen on Ni(100) and Ni(210) single-crystal surfaces using X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy. They found that as oxygen interacts with the surfaces, Ni2+ and Ni3+ states are formed, which are characteristic features of oxygen interaction with nickel surfaces. The study provides insights into the defect chemistry and reactivity of oxide overlayers on nickel surfaces.
